column5: We crossed the border at International Falls in late June with 2 vehicles with 2 people in each truck. After all of the usual questions we both declared having 4 cases of beer in each truck. We were expecting to pay duty on the extra cases of beer but were each waved on through. Have the limits on beer changed or did we just get lucky?
what time and day did you cross? sounds like i need to coordinate my departure a little better...LOL. i bet they just a little lenient on ya, as i haven't heard of any changes.
I think the rules are the same as always. Maybe you were lucky, or got the agent confused.
1 cs (24-12 oz) pp is what is allowed.
We have had that happen to us before if we were 1 or 2 cases over. I guess it depends which customs guy you get and they probably appreciate the honesty.
I've crossed the boarder with four cases over the limit and they have let me through. The limits have not changed, sometimes they make a deal of it, others they don't.
Can somone who is 19 claim a case since they are legal to drink in Canada?
